Job Title: Agile Technical Project Manager

Location: Auburn Hills, MI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
HTC Global Services wants you. Come build new things with us and advance your career. At HTC Global you'll collaborate with experts. You'll join successful teams contributing to our clients' success. You'll work side by side with our clients and have long-term opportunities to advance your career with the latest emerging technologies.

At HTC Global Services our consultants have access to a comprehensive benefits package. Benefits can include Paid-Time-Off, Paid Holidays, 401K matching, Life and Accidental Death Insurance, Short & Long Term Disability Insurance, and a variety of other perks.

Skills And Experience

Years of Experience: 8 years.Foster an environment of cooperation and collaboration with Brand, Department, Division and Group and Corporate management, business leaders, stakeholders, and ITPO as it pertains to the Connected Services Program.Responsible for the uptime and availability of Connected Services telematics solution and its supporting applications.Coach, mentor, develop and lead a best-in-class development team capable of delivering excellent results through agile iterative development methodologies to solving complex technical and business challenges in the area of Connected Services.Report to senior executives on the progress of individual projects and the overall program.Participate in the creation of project budgets for the individual project components, and prepare cost estimates for the program based on this information.During the life cycle of a program, manage the program budget to conform to policy, develop processes for requesting, spending and reporting expenditures, and be accountable for the program's financial performance.Exercise independent judgment and discretion in overall project management by prioritizing, planning and tracking project progress.Lead technical decisions and solutions to minimize the duration and severity of business impacts leveraging ITIL standards, and to ensure up-time and stability SLAs are achieved.Interface with application developers to coordinate systems implementation and releases.Provide high-quality service to our business customers as a primary support contact for our applications.Collaborate with Product Management and business owners in defining the Product Vision including strategies for utilizing and managing incoming data.Provide technical direction through the outlining of “stories” and sprints to the Connected Services development team supporting the customer web portal, Liferay platform, architecture, technical solutions, and code.Highly knowledgeable and practical expertise in Agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban), execution of Agile ceremonies and events (Sprint Planning, Stand-up, Refinement, etc), Agile artifacts (Sprints, Backlogs), and high level of proficiency in Agile tools (Confluence, JIRA, Visio, Azure Dev Ops, etc.). Manage cross-functional team of Developers, Analysts, DevOps, and QA resources, with experience in leading all phases of the software development lifecycle to ensure development and delivery is aligned with prioritized program roadmap targets and Release Management processes. Ability to manage multiple high-profile projects, manage team capacity and dynamics, mitigate risks, escalate and resolve roadblocks, and provide transparency and tracking of all project progress and deliverables. Exceptional leader and communicator, adept at fostering team collaboration and cultivating cohesive IT/Business partnerships, with an overarching responsibility to oversee, support and deliver high-quality software to targeted markets.

Education

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
